Location: 11325 Random Hills Rd,Suite 750, Fairfax, VA 22030

Job Type: Internship

About Brightcove

Brightcove is a team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We're hyped up about storytelling, and about helping people connect, share experiences, and view the world. Bottom line: video is the world's most compelling, exciting medium, and Brightcove exists to demonstrate that video means business.

As the industry leader in this space, we empower our customers to deliver top-notch video experiences to audiences on every screen in bold and innovative ways. When video is done right, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change. Creativity thrives. Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and passions and we have built a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence and collaboration. This culture enables us to develop technologies once thought impossible, provide customer support without parallel or excuses, and leverage the expertise and resources of a global infrastructure. We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as one team.

Team Overview

Brightcove's Research is a team of highly motivated, fast-paced, and highly skilled researchers with expertise in video compression, video processing, and video delivery systems. We develop highly innovative, state of the art technologies for use in future Brightcove products. Our work also results in contributions to relevant standards and industry forums (ISO/IEC/MPEG, JVET, SMPTE, DASH-IF, UHDF, CTA WAVE, etc.), patent applications, and publications in peer-reviewed conferences and journals. We seek candidates with the following qualifications and responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement innovative video pre-processing techniques for improved efficiency of video encoding. These may include noise reduction, film-grain detection, removal and synthesis, perceptual pre-filtering, etc.
Research, design, and implement innovative encoder-level optimization techniques (rate control, optimized quantization, mode decisions, etc.)
Research, design, and implement innovative coding techniques for future video codecs, such as VVC and AI/ML-based compression
Conduct subjective quality assessment tests, and/or automated tests using properly selected objective metrics and a comparison process
Document and present the new algorithms and implementations in various forms, such as standards contributions, publications, technical white papers, patent applications, etc.

Qualifications/Experience

Completed graduate-level coursework towards a Ph.D. or MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.
Experience working with OpenCV and other computer-vision libraries and algorithms (face detection, object detection pipelines, structure from motion, CNN-based algorithms, etc.)
Practical experience working with PyTorch, TensorFlow, and other frameworks for the design of deep-learning algorithms
Knowledge of the existing video coding algorithms (H.264, HEVC, VVC, VP8, AV1, etc.) and their fundamental building blocks (transforms, quantizers, ME/MC techniques, in-loop filters, rate control, HRD model, etc.)
Experience working with existing video codec implementations (MPEG & ITU-T test models, x264, x265, SVT-AV1, MainConcept SDKs, etc.)
Experience working with stream analyzers (Elecard StreamEye, Sencore CMA 1280, etc.)
Understanding of color science and color processing as used in modern SDR and HDR systems
Understanding of fundamentals of human vision and models useful for image and video coding (spatial- and temporal contrast sensitivity, masking, saliency models, etc.)
Familiarity with subjective quality assessment methodologies (ITU-R BT.500, BT.710, BT.2022) and experience in conducting subjective tests
Familiarity with the existing objective quality metrics and tools for quality analysis (PSNR, SSIM, 3D-SSIM, SSIMplus, VDP, Tektronix PQA, VideoClarity, etc.)
Experience using MATLAB, Mathematica, or other scientific programming languages and tools
Experience in Python and C/C++ programming and using the related libraries and tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Additional/Desirable skills

Expertise in statistical data analysis and machine learning
Expertise in areas of computer vision (detection, tracking, structure from motion, etc.)
Experience in SIMD (SSE, AVX, AVX2) and/or GPU (CUDA, OpenCV) programming
Experience in distributed programming and using cloud platforms (AWS, Goggle Compute, etc.)

Working at Brightcove

As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company's success. We offer competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement, as well as generous PTO - and we expect you to use it!

We offer flexible options to work in our Boston office located in Fort Point harbor, remotely or in a hybrid set up (only exceptions are the roles that MUST work a certain way which we are finalizing soon). Whichever option you choose, we have plenty of opportunities to meet your colleagues around the globe and we also celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!

If you've gotten all the way to the bottom of this description, thank you for your interest in Brightcove! If this role sounds like something that is exciting to you please don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't meet all of our qualifications. We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Please note that while this job description is an accurate description of the role, it is also subject to change during the course of this search.

Send us your resume if you are interested and want to learn more!

LOCATION: Remote and/or Tysons Corner, VA

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

Are you looking for an Internship opportunity in Supply Chain Strategy & Digital Transformation with a trusted advisor in digital end-to-end supply chain strategy and operations?


Look no further!


At Supply Chain Wizard we strive to be the premier supply chain services company that attracts, develops and empowers highly talented people. Our success depends on this.


The Role


The Supply Chain Strategy Intern participates in all aspects of the Customer Success lifecycle, primarily supporting manufacturing clients and their digital factory & supply chain transformation journey.


We take an innovative approach to Supply Chain Transformation. SCW leverages BI dashboards, IoT devices, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning to monitor and predict potential issues and provide proactive and preventive support for our Manufacturing clients to support their digital transformation journey. Therefore, this role requires a “can do”, “can learn”, “can support” attitude.


We are looking for an energetic Supply Chain Strategy Intern, who will:


  • Continuously monitor strategic clients to ensure issue-free usage of our products in the Digital Factory Suite i.e. OEE Tracker, Digital Logbook, Scheduler.
  • Understand business challenges and cases, directly solve problems or translate them into internal mechanisms to resolve problems.
  • Be proactive in identifying issues and cases on behalf of clients to maximize the value they get out of our products.
  • Advocate client requirements among internal teams and support internal product development lifecycle.
  • Create and organize documentation to maintain a knowledge base, user manuals and training materials.
  • Prepare and present periodic business reports
  • Take part in SCW's strategic initiatives and support executive team in digital transformation projects
  • Take part in select supply chain strategy and/or transformation client projects and support client services teams

This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your coursework with practical industry experience while being an integral part of a high-growth, high-impact start-up organization.


Your work will matter!


Desired Skills and Experience


Ideal candidates will have the following attributes:


  • Working towards or recently obtained a bachelor’s or master’s degree in the following curricula: Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics or a similar discipline
  • Excellent communication skills in English
  • Strong collaboration and presentation skills
  • Strong organizational and detail oriented analytical problem-solving skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Previous experience with software product support is a plus
  • Proficiency in BI Tools is a plus

About Us


Supply Chain Wizard, a two times Inc. 5000 honoree in Americas Fastest Growing Private Companies List (2018, 2019), Financial Times Top 500 Americas' Fastest Growing Companies honoree (2020) and a Gartner Cool Vendor in 2019 Supply Chain Execution Technologies, is a management consulting, digital innovation and solutions firm, and a global leader specializing in serialization and traceability, supply chain strategy and operational transformation programs with the presence in North America, Latin America, Europe, Middle East and Asia. Headquartered in Princeton, NJ, Supply Chain Wizard partners with organizations in designing, developing and implementing digital solutions using state-of-the-art technologies such as Internet-of-Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and Blockchain through its Cloud Platform to enable end-to-end Digital Supply Chain Transformations in Life Sciences & Pharmaceutical industry. Serving some of the world's largest pharmaceutical manufacturers, contract manufacturers and packagers, Supply Chain Wizard is dedicated to adding sustainable value through data-driven decision making from Shop Floor to Executive Boardrooms. This is the place to learn and grow.

Overview:
The SAGE Publishing Technologies Digital Accessibility Internship offers the opportunity to learn more about the academic publishing industry while developing the skills needed to succeed in digital accessibility and technology positions.

The role will allow someone to gain hands-on experience and learn about digital accessibility and general academic publishing. They will engage in work pertaining to digital educational products that is project-based, multifaceted, fast-paced, intellectually exciting, and above all, collaborative. This position assists, maintains, and helps drive a range of accessibility testing and documentation activities.

This role is best suited for self-starters who are curious, organized, take initiative, ask questions, share feedback, participate in meetings, and are passionate about digital accessibility in higher education.

This internship is paid, part-time (16–25 hours per week during normal office hours) position for the fall 2021 academic semester with the possibility of extending into future semesters and/or the summer based on performance and continued interest. Interns will work remotely and, in the SAGE Washington, DC, office on a mutually agreed schedule.

Job functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Assist accessibility specialist in conducting automated, manual, and screen reader testing on SAGE platforms and content
  • Record test results for incorporation into SAGE accessibility documentation
  • Support digital resource and assessment development
  • Provide user feedback on new products and platforms
  • Conduct research
  • Participate in regular and ad hoc meetings

  • Must be an active student currently working toward the completion of a degree at an accredited college or university. Preferred programs of study are Digital Accessibility, Universal Design, Web Design, Computer Science, Publishing, or a related field
  • It is essential to have a basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and/or JavaScript

Description:

Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Quantitative Investment Intern to our location in Renton, WA or Irvine, CA.

We are seeking a Quantitative Investment Intern to assist the Manager of Investment Risk in assessing our internal tools for assessing and managing investment risks, and creating management reports summarizing the key themes and risks in the existing investment portfolio, focused on $5.5 billion of long term investment assets and $1.5 billion of pension assets. As an integral member of the System's investment team, the Quantitative RIsk Analyst will assist in enhancing and maintaining the System investment models and tools used to monitor portfolio performance, asset allocation and exposures, cash flows and liquidity. Additionally, the intern will prepare reports and support analysis for recommendations to senior management as well as to contribute to general reporting and control processes. In particular, the candidate is expected to assist the Manager of Risk in working with one or more outside vendors to implement a comprehensive risk management architecture for the system, which will cover $10bn plus of assets and over 100 external investment managers.

In this position you will have the following responsibilities:

  • Assist with managing, maintaining, and organizing various reports and documentation related to portfolio analytics.
  • Utilizes investment related software and applications to generate portfolio analysis and perform reconciliation and other reports, including but not limited to monthly, quarterly reports, and other ad hoc requests.
  • Ensures accuracy of data and timeliness of reporting for the system/region/entity/division.
  • Assists with creating and maintaining financial models.
  • Assists in preparing and compiling various reports, templates and analysis to support annual reporting and audit work.

Qualifications:

Required qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Finance/Accounting/Computer Science.
  • 3 months Finance/Computational Finance role in a financial institution or related entity.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's Degree in Computational Finance/Financial Engineering or equivalent education/experience.

Are you ready to kickstart your cybersecurity career? Are you analytical and a problem solver by nature? Do you value working in a positive culture where you action big ideas? Are you excited to work in a collaborative security operations environment?

If you answered YES, you might be just the person we are looking for.

We are CyberForce|Q and we protect the cyber realm as a collective force for good. For over 25 years we have provided innovative cybersecurity solutions to our clients. Our TEAM is growing, and we are looking for an aspiring cybersecurity professional to join us! 

What You’ll Do

  • Actively respond to real-world cyber-attacks.
  • Triage incoming tickets to the SOC.
  • Work with best-of-breed vendor technologies.
  • Work with SIEM & SOAR platforms.
  • Interact regularly with business owners, CISO's, and vendors as needed to see tickets through resolution.
  • Collaborate with other IT security professionals to provide exceptional support and problem resolution as a member of our SOC.
  • Participate in team initiatives.

Schedule

  • Our SOC operates 24x7x365.
  • Part-time team members must work a minimum of 24 hours a week.
  • We will find out your scheduling restrictions (i.e. class schedules, professional groups and other obligations) and the schedule will be built around your availability and the team's needs for coverage.
  • Shifts do not rotate and do not change weekly.

Location

  • This position is 100% remote.
  • You must live within a reasonable distance to travel to the Greater Phoenix, AZ area.
  • Candidates applying who do not reside in Arizona will not be considered for this role.

What You Bring to the TEAM

  • Ability to easily and effectively communicate technical information, written or verbally.
  • Desire to work as a part of a highly interactive team; regularly communicating with other team members and clients.
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure.
  • Ability to manage time effectively and complete projects on time.
  • Ability to differentiate between a significant event, a true positive, and a false positive.
  • Understanding of OSI model and ability to apply to troubleshooting issues.
  • Knowledge of networking, packet flow, TCP/UDP traffic, and firewalls.
  • Modem, router, reliable internet and dedicated workspace at home to support remote work.

Things We Love to See But Aren't Requirements

  • Ability to write scripts/code using Python, Perl, PowerShell, or an equivalent language.
  • Studying for or achieved certifications such as CompTIA Security+, Cisco CCENT, or Certified HIPAA Security Professional (CHSP)
  • Technical help desk, technical troubleshooting, or information security role experience.
  • Pursuing or completed Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Defense, Cybersecurity or a related discipline from an accredited institution.
  • Splunk or Qradar knowledge/experience.

Why Join Us

  • Make a Difference. Work in a flourishing industry where the work we do helps people.
  • Upgrade Your Skills. As a member of our security operations, you’ll gain exposure to many networks and tools as well industry professionals inside and outside of CFQ.
  • Opportunity for Promotion. Join our team in an entry level role and work towards cybersecurity analyst skills! Team members that excel in this role may be eligible to join our team full-time. You are in the driver's seat of your own career development!
  • Get School Credit: This role can fulfill internship requirements. Please contact your college or university directly to determine if our role can satisfy your internship requirement.

  • Professional development assistance

  • Weekend availability

  • What classes or projects have you done related to networking, cybersecurity, or information assurance?

Who We Are:
MicroVision, Inc. (NASDAQ: MVIS), a leader in MEMS based solid state automotive lidar for advanced driver safety (ADAS) and autonomous driving sensor and micro-display technology for augmented reality is the pioneer and creator of PicoP® scanning technology, an ultra-miniature laser projection and sensing solution based on the laser beam scanning methodology. The technology is well suited to support a wide array of applications including interactive projection, robotics, industrial applications, and Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR). MicroVision is an independently recognized leader for its formidable intellectual property portfolio. The company is based in Redmond, Washington.

Is this You:
MicroVision currently has an opportunity in our Test Engineering Team for an Intern Test Engineer. This role requires a balance of both software and hardware strategies to help develop and validate characterization test as well as production calibration and test solutions for automotive lidar applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Design test cases and write LabVIEW code to verify device calibration software libraries.
  • Assist experienced test engineers in the development and verification of production test and calibration routines.
  • Perform statistical data analysis to identify issues and drive improvements.

Required skills:

  • Highly self-motivated to take ownership of problems and drive solutions.
  • Hands-on engineering experience in lab courses, extra-curricular activities, or work experience.
  • Strong programming skill in any language: Python, LabVIEW, C, C++, C#, MATLAB, etc. Experience in LabVIEW and/or Python is preferred.
  • Some experience with electrical, optical, or mechanical components testing. Experience testing lasers and/or image processing for machine vision is preferred.
  • Some experience with basic statistical data analysis.

Required Experience:

Overview:

We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!

As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture.

We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more!

Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations and the process of joining the State Farm team!
Responsibilities:
State Farm has developed a unique internship opportunity for graduate students at the University of Illinois - the Modeling and Analytics Graduate Network (MAGNet). MAGNet interns apply their statistical modeling and analytic skills to a wide variety of business problems faced by the State Farm organization.

Most MAGNet interns are in the Statistics Department's graduate program, but graduate students in other highly quantitative disciplines may also be considered. While participating in the MAGNet program, students are evaluated and given consideration for full time post graduate employment at various State Farm locations: Bloomington IL, Atlanta GA, Dallas TX or Champaign IL.

MAGNet interns apply their predictive modeling and data analysis skills to a variety of business problems, in many different lines of business and departments (e.g., marketing, insurance and banking) including:
 Pricing and Underwriting Risk Predictive Modeling
 Claims Automation Predictive Modeling
 Sales/Growth Forecasting, Econometric and Predictive Modeling
 Data mining applications for Claims and Competitive Analysis
 Evaluating new statistical methods and tools for potential use by State Farm Modelers
Qualifications:
Interns are assigned based to a wide variety of departments for experience, based on major and interest area.

Majors considered:
 Statistics
 Mathematics
 Computer Science
 Finance
 Economics
 Actuarial Science
 Data Science

We Are Looking For The Following:
 Applicants must be accepted or currently enrolled in an approved Graduate program at University of Illinois
 Statistical modeling and/or data mining experience
 Data analysis and experience with database tools
 Computer programming (specifically SAS, R, or Python) skills
 Communication and presentations skills

What You Can Expect:
 During the academic year, MAGNet interns will work 20 hours a week
 Internship duration: Fall 2021 semester 8/23/2021 to 12/10/2021
What’s In It For You:

MAGNet is similar to a 50% graduate assistantship offered by the University and interns receive hourly pay comparable to that offered by the University for graduate assistants, as well as full tuition assistance for the duration of the internship. As with an assistantship, tuition costs are covered.

Some State Farm benefits may also apply, including the following:
 Relaxed dress code
 Direct experience you can leverage for you future career
 An opportunity to learn and network with industry-leading influencers
 A Learning Environment: Mentoring and Development to help you succeed
 We love to give back! Being involved in volunteer opportunities to give back to the community
 A culture that embraces Diversity and Inclusion - it is simply the right thing to do!

FleishmanHillard’s St. Louis is seeking qualified candidates for full-time paid Creative intern positions. Interns are an integral part of our teams, giving participants real-life experience and skills that will help them succeed in their communications careers in the future.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Deadlines for Fall submissions: July 1
The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least five months (September 1, 2021 – January 14, 2022)
Responsibilities:
ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS
Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.

COPYWRITERS
Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

VIDEO EDITORS
Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
  • A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
  • Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS
Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
  • Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
  • Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS
Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.
  • Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.
  • Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have at least a 3.2 GPA, previous relevant internship experience(s) and completed their junior year of college, though recent graduates are preferred. All candidates must also exhibit a desire and motivation to learn and the ability to work as part of a team.

Your Application Submission Must Include All of the Following:
  • Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
  • Resume
  • Portfolio
  • Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
  • Transcript (can be unofficial)

Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Education and/or Experience
Student within three or four semesters of completing an accredited college degree in computer science or information technology; or three to six months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Computer Skills
To perform the job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Language Skills
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 50 pounds. Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions, which may include heat, cold and various forms of precipitation. The employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Work Hours
Business hours are Monday – Friday 9 am – 5pm, however, additional hours may be required on weekends,
evenings and some holidays. Additional hours may also be required as part of an on-call rotation to cover some weekends, evenings, and holidays throughout the year.

Duties

Summary

Want to help shape national and global policy on finance and national security? Interested in learning more about a career in public service? Come spend a intern with us at the U.S. Department of the Treasury. Treasury’s Departmental Offices (headquarters) seeks enthusiastic, dedicated students for its dynamic and substantive internship program. ALL STUDENTS MUST BE ABLE TO INTERN BETWEEN SEPTEMBER 6 - DECEMBER 10, 2021.


Responsibilities

This is your opportunity to support Treasury in promoting economic prosperity and ensuring the financial security of the United States. Internships at Treasury give students a unique opportunity to:

  • Gain substantive career experience related to your academic interests,
  • Acquire lifelong leadership, management, and analytical skills,
  • Explore different career avenues in the public sector,
  • Build professional relationships, contacts, and networks, and
  • Observe the daily operations and working environment of a cabinet-level federal agency.

Are you right for our team?

Think Treasury careers are just for economists and accountants? Think again. Treasury seeks students from a broad range of fields and studies that include, but are not limited to:

  • Social Sciences (Economics, Political Science, Public Policy, International Affairs, International Development)
  • Management/Law (Business Management, Public Administration, Finance, Accounting, Human Resources, Marketing, Communications/Journalism, Legal Studies/Law)
  • STEM (Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics/Statistics)

Students can work in one of many offices which make up Treasury Departmental Offices (headquarters). Departmental Offices is a collection of divisions that are primarily responsible for policy formulation and overall management of the Treasury Department. As part of the application process, you will be asked to apply to up to three offices described on Treasury's website https://home.treasury.gov/about/offices.

Opportunities to contribute in these offices are far-reaching and depend on mission need and student interest. If you interested in

Boosting U.S. economic growth, read more about the:

  • Office of Domestic Finance,
  • Office of Tax Policy, and
  • Office of Economic Policy.

Promoting financial stability, read more about the:

  • Office of Domestic Finance, and
  • Office of International Affairs.

Enhancing national security, read more about the:

  • Office of Terrorism and Financial Intelligence and
  • Office of International Affairs.

Transforming government-wide financial stewardship, read more about the:

  • Office of Domestic Finance.

Helping Treasury achieve operational excellence, read more about the:

  • Office of Management, which is responsible for the internal management and policy of the Department in the areas of budget, planning, human resources, information technology and management, financial management and accounting, procurement, privacy, records, and administrative services,
  • General Counsel,
  • Legislative Affairs, and
  • Public Affairs.

While duties and responsibilities will vary by office assignment, examples of potential duties include:

  • Collecting, analyzing, and presenting data in support of policy priorities
  • Researching and summarizing academic literature and news pertinent to mission areas
  • Drafting talking points, briefing materials, and reports for Treasury leaders and stakeholders
  • Attending and reporting on relevant Congressional hearings, official meetings, and conferences in and outside of government
  • Interacting with Treasury colleagues and other U.S. government agencies on relevant matters
  • Organizing high-level meetings and/or conferences
  • Contributing to key management functions and initiatives, such as budget formulation; strategic planning and organizational performance evaluation; human capital planning; information technology system launches and upgrades; and web content management.

Travel Required

Not required

Supervisory status

No

Promotion Potential

00

  • Job family (Series)

    0099 General Student Trainee

  • Requirements

    Requirements

    Conditions of Employment

    • Must be a U.S. Citizen
    • Must pass Background Investigation/Security Clearance
    • Actively enrolled at least part-time in an accredited institution
    • Must be in good academic standing (2.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale)
    • RELOCATION AND HOUSING EXPENSES ARE PAID BY STUDENT
    • Must have home computer (Maximum Telework Due to Pandemic)

    To be eligible for this internship all of the following requirements must be met:

    1.Be a U.S. Citizen
    2.Be at least 16 years of age
    3.Currently enrolled or accepted for enrollment as a part-time degree-seeking student at an accredited institution
    4.If enrolled, be in good academic standing

Department
  • Global Sales Operations
Mentor's Title:

This position will support corporate initiatives and programs utilizing the salesforce.com platform. This position will be responsible for the data in Leviton's sales management pipeline system. Poor data is the #1 reason CRM systems fail, making data management very important. In addition, this intern will assist in process improvement while supporting each business unit / channel utilizing salesforce.com.
Responsibilities:
  • Utilize a system's resources and tools to drive decisions regarding the data
  • Responsible for overseeing our data management application, Validity, and its connection to Salesforce.com
  • Comply with departmental procedures as well as find areas for process improvement
  • Serve as the data manager and incorporate new processes, policies, and guidelines to administer a central database
  • Understanding a systems platform through building custom functionality, data modeling, and data management
  • Driving user engagement across all sales systems through providing training and support
  • Basic understanding of project management methodology
  • Additional duties as assigned
Qualifications:
Education & Experience
  • Update the degrees to Technology, Business, Data Analytics
  • Must be a student currently enrolled as a sophomore or higher pursing a degree in Technology, Behavior Sciences, Business, or Marketing
  • Must have the ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, and / or governmental regulations
  • Must have excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Must have strong presentation skills and well developed interpersonal skills
  • Must be proficient in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Word and have the ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, percentages, and other statistical calculations
  • Must have strong research, analytical, and critical thinking skills Programming / coding knowledge is favored
  • Desired Major: Information Technology / Computer Science / Business
  • Work Schedule: Flexible with school schedule
  • 20-29 hours per week

#LI-EZ1

Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are actively seeking an Intern to join our Vehicle Integration team. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

    • Develop a key tracking tool to feed several departments across the organization
    • Understand the whole process leading to the tool need and usage
    • Document the creation process, implementation, and way to evolve the tool
    • Work with engineering tools (CAD/PLM, Digital Factory, etc.) and IT to understand their applicable capabilities and limitations for each team
    • Troubleshoot manufacturing tool issues with the service team
    • Support the Service Engineers with various technical issues
    • Grow the team's knowledge bank through thorough documentation of issue resolution
    • Support PLM Analysts with review and documentation of product changes
    • Utilize Tableau to manage large data sets
    • Some projects include:
    • PLM Enterprise System interfaces
    • Program kickoff of new vehicle programs (e.gt., gravity)
    • Implementation of many new CAD/manufacturing software tools

Qualifications

    • Associate’s, Bachelor’s, or Post-Secondary Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or Data Science or related fields (Recent graduates are eligible up to 12 months after graduation)
    • Some CAD (Solidworks, Fusion 360, Catia) and PLM (ENOVIA, TeamCenter) experience
    • Strong organizational skills
    • Experience with managing large data sets
    • Experience with Catia (v5and/ or V6) is preferred
    • Experience with Tableau is preferred
    • Experience with Python, C++, or other related programming languages is preferred

Other

    • Programming Timing: September 7th – November 26th, 2021 (12 weeks); End date can be extended up to December 23rd, 2021 based on individual needs; Some flexibility with start date is available if needed
    • Availability: Full-time preferred but Part-Time available
    • Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start on site for your first day of employment
    • Work Environment: Production Lab
    • Anticipated Hours: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm
    • Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable
    • Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization
    • Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week
    • Housing: No compensation for housing
    • Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses currently
    • Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence
    • Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area
    • Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check
    • Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors, you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

Overview:
Hours: This is a 10-20 hours per week position with flexible hours, Monday through Friday, between core business hours of 8:00am and 5:00pm.

The Wisconsin Foundation & Alumni Association (WFAA)*, the private fundraising and alumni relations organization for UW-Madison, is recruiting for a Business Intelligence Intern. This position will work as part of the Business Intelligence team to standardizing reporting code and continuous reports maintenance in support of the Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association business processes.

Who is WFAA?
The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association is a private, nonprofit corporation that encourages individuals and organizations to make gifts to the university and to connect with the UW. In 2014, the UW Foundation merged with the Wisconsin Alumni Association® to better serve a growing population of UW alumni and donors. We believe that private support grows out of good relationships between campus leaders, faculty and program staff who need support, and the alumni and friends who want to invest in UW–Madison. We provide important engagement opportunities to link UW–Madison alumni to each other and to their alma mater, building a strong community of Badgers.

Diversity and Inclusion:
Just as the university community benefits from differing viewpoints, perspectives, and experiences, inclusion and diversity are imperative for the success of our mission. WFAA values people and the differences that they bring to the organization, and creates an environment in which all staff members and constituents feel respected and have opportunities to thrive.
Essential Functions:
  • Converting reports to use stored procedures
  • Upkeep of column updates within reports
  • Report execution tracking
Qualifications:
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Statistics/Economics/Mathematics/Engineering/Computer Science or other Quantitative background.
  • Demonstrates ability to explain analytical processes and deliver data in easy-to-understand, visual reports.
  • Familiarity working with databases/SQL and Excel.
  • Good documentation and communication skills.
  • Team player, attention to detail, motivation to learn new technologies and develop business understanding.

The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association is an Equal Opportunity Employer *The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association is the “doing business as” name of the merged organization comprising the University of Wisconsin Foundation (supportuw.org) and the Wisconsin Alumni Association (uwalumni.com). Its legal corporate name is registered as the University of Wisconsin Foundation.

Overview:
UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

This position is Limited Term. The internship will last 6 months with the opportunity to extend an additional 6 months based on organization/team needs. The individual will work up to 40 hours a week during the summer months and approximately 15-20 hours a week during the school semester. These hours can be flexible to meet your school needs.

The IT Desktop Support Intern must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of the Organization in a positive manner.
Responsibilities:
1) Preparing and deploying IT hardware - 50%
Assist the End User Services team by receiving new hardware, tracking inventory, imaging laptops and desktop computers, installing and testing hardware. This includes scheduling and coordinating with end users, following a tested process of updating the Operating System, installing required applications, following provided instructions, testing and troubleshooting as needed. Working with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

2) Office Moves - 20%
Assist with moving staff from one location to another and move staff from one area of a building to another following a move plan and move schedule. This includes disconnecting and reconnecting PCs, monitors and peripherals as well as documenting cable and switchport details.

3) PC Replacements - 30%
Assist with the replacement of Desktop hardware. Coordinate and schedule with end users, the replacement of their desktop PC and decommission the old PC following documented procedures. Work with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.
Qualifications:


  • Pursuing associates or bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred.
  • A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office applications, and Outlook preferred.
  • Experience in providing customer service or support preferred.
  • The ability to demonstrate strong interpersonal skill, communicate clearly and interact professionally with other employees preferred.
  • Minimum of 6 months experience in customer service or support required.

UW Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Minorities, Protected Veterans, Women, and individuals with Disabilities. We strive to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is home to a diverse workforce where employees at all levels model knowledge of, belief in and a commitment to cultural competence.

Overview:
Our 6-month Military Internship Program is a paid internship program that helps veterans' transition back into the workforce. Our program provides Military Interns with on-the-job experience in the banking and financial services industry. An internship with Fulton Bank provides opportunity to explore your career interests, while helping you gain valuable insights into the working life at Fulton. Under close supervision with a designated Supervisor, you will be responsible for observing the policies and procedures within a specific area/department of the Bank, while acquiring knowledge through on-the-job training and building essential skills.

In addition, you will have the opportunity to build your professional network, engage in professional development opportunities, and participate in a variety of team-based activities and Fulton Bank events or initiatives. No matter the location of your internship, we will give you the tools to succeed in a real-world setting!

Activities and responsibilities vary by assignment. Strong academic performance is required. Previous work, leadership experience, and community involvement is preferred. A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of the department such as: Accounting, Finance, Risk, Information Systems, Business Analytics, Computer Science, and/or Business-related majors.

Additional Details:
  • Fall 2021 Start Date.
  • Work location: East Petersburg, PA.
  • Ideal candidate is able to work full-time (40 hours per week Monday-Friday).
  • Flexible work hours or shifts will be considered in order to meet the needs of academic requirements. Remote work accommodations are contingent upon safety orders/restrictions. Must be able to work on-site.
As a condition of employment, individuals must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship for a work visa by Fulton Financial Corporation currently or in the future.
Responsibilities:
  • Assists in a wide range of opportunities with tasks in their assigned department.
  • Performs assigned duties in designated department to acquire knowledge of methods, procedures, and standards required for successful performance.
  • Completes progress reports in Internship Program and gives feedback about program to Manager and Talent Acquisition team. Management feedback must indicate satisfactory progress to remain in Internship Program.
  • A Military Intern may participate in Career Training/Education as needed, as well as, professional development and networking events.

Scope of Work:
  • Intern support is extremely valuable in decreasing call wait time, increasing customer satisfaction and experience, and enhancing corporate metrics.
  • Assists with day-to-day operations of the IT Support Center, including but not limited to: password resets, troubleshooting, and verbal or written communication with internal customers.
Qualifications:

Education: High School Diploma or equivalent.

  • Specialty: Specific course of study not required. (Required)

Experience: 6 to 12 months.

  • Must be a Veteran with an honorable discharge. (Required)
  • Should not have completed more than one (1) continuous year of employment in a previous Fulton internship. (Required)
  • Experience requirements will align to the needs of the assigned department, however strong customer service and communication skills are strongly preferred.
  • Ideal candidate has a general technical background, is considered to be a team player but also works well independently, demonstrates a positive outlook, and can effectively multitask/handle multiple priorities simultaneously. Looking for a self-starter with demonstrated initiative, proven leadership abilities, and strong interpersonal skills.
EEO Statement: Fulton Bank (“Fulton”) is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all qualified persons. Fulton will recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles, and ensure that all other personnel actions are administered, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity, age, genetic information, marital status, disability, covered veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

GEI a Way of Life

When you re doing what you love and working with great people, work becomes less like a job, and more like a way of life. Here at GEI Consultants, Inc. (GEI) we have been fostering growth and creativity for nearly 50 years. Our culture is one of collaboration and support. If you are passionate about your field, excited about learning, and constantly looking for ways to innovate, we d love to have you join the GEI family.

Who are we?

GEI Consultants, Inc. is an employee-owned, leading consulting engineering and environmental firm ranked #88 in the ENR top 500 (2020). We partner with hundreds of government, energy, industry and institutional clients, and have completed 50,000 project engagements throughout the United States, Canada, and more than 20 other countries. We are sought out for our ideas, our creativity, and most of all, for the quality and character of our people.

Job Description

The Web Developer is responsible for the development and design of database driven web applications, GIS based web applications, GIS mapping applications, and components for clients. The developer will design, develop, test, and deliver web sites, applications, and components. The developer will create web applications and components from the requirements analysis, through design, coding, and testing, to production. Adaptability and ability to learn quickly in various technical and creative environments while delivering quality work under tight deadlines are key attributes of the job.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Practical experience in HTML, JavaScript, CSS and AJAX for web development
  • Proficient in some of the following: Java, JSP, ASP.NET, XML, and JSON
  • Knowledge of database including Oracle, Access, or SQL server
  • Experience in providing high quality deliverables on time
  • Self motivated, detail-oriented, and organized
  • Major in computer-related field (computer science/engineering)
  • Able to work in person at the Sacramento office location. (in compliance with CA state COVID restrictions)

description:
Overview:
Position exists to provide a centralized reporting and problem resolution facility to support users of Information Technology. User support will be given by researching, analyzing, and resolving Information Technology user problems. Individuals in this position record all calls received and initiate appropriate corrective action.
Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Log all problems reported to the Help Desk via the problem tracking system.
Provide technical support to resolve user problems through problem determination and analysis.
Resolve any hardware, communication, or application issues with the appropriate vendors.
Configure, install, and maintain computer operating systems and related software.
Provide computer hardware installation assistance.
Provide Help Desk coverage other than normal company working hours as required.
Regular, predictable attendance as employee has to physically be in the office.
This list of Essential Functions is non-exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary.


OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES
Fulfill administrative reporting requirements.
Maintain a current knowledge of technical computer subjects deemed necessary to fulfill the essential requirements of the job.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS
Physical demands: Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds; Speaking; Sitting for long periods; Kneeling; Crawling; Normal vision/hearing with or without correction; Typing; Driving a vehicle.
Mental demands: Analytical reasoning; Ability to work under pressure and on own initiative; Prolonged concentration; Creative problem solving techniques.
Environmental factors: Standard office lighting, temperature, and noise; Some overnight travel required.
Equipment: Various computer equipment; Telephone; Auto/Truck/Van.
Qualifications:
Actively enrolled in college courses working toward a degree in the Information Technology field of study.
Relevant experience involving use of computer equipment and automated systems preferred.
General business skills and emphasis on attention to detail and problem resolution.
Exceptional customer service and communication skills.
Ability to maintain composure under adverse situations.
Excellent work attendance record.
Valid driver’s license and good driving record.

At Wipfli, people count

Company Name: Master Lock Overview:
The IT Intern – Business Applications will assist in maintaining and developing programs, code modifications, application administration, and day-to-day support under direct supervision. This position will work closely with developers and business analysts to understand programming and application requirements. This role will modify, develop, test, implement, configure, and support business applications. This individual will participate as a member of the Information Technology team to provide effective, efficient, and innovative solutions in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. The IT Intern – Business Applications will work under the direct supervision of IT team members to develop technical skills, build business acumen, and learn about and support business applications supporting various key business functions.
Responsibilities:
  • Modify existing applications, code new applications, and support those applications and systems.
  • Assist with coding, testing, documenting, modifying, and debugging applications, interfaces, scripts, reports, forms, and other programmable components of application systems.
  • Respond to specifications developed by others and participate in end-user support as required.
  • Please adhere to the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Change Management disciplines of IT to maintain appropriate quality levels and reduce risk in the operation of systems, equipment, and general business processing.
  • Participate in, and contribute to “Strategic Initiative,” “Maintain the Business,” and “Continuous Improvement” projects as a project team member or developer.
  • Update existing project plans, create new project plans, and track the progress of project tasks with assigned resources to record progress and identify risks to the critical path.
  • Assist with project planning, project updates, project status reports, resource allocation, and resource leveling under the guidance of a project manager for larger projects.

Support the IT team in various responsibilities as required.
Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology/Computer Programming/Information Systems or related field with educational level coding experience in SQL, PL/SQL, Java, Perl, Python, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), C, C++, HTML, AJAX, Groovy, or similar programming languages; minimum sophomore standing at an accredited university.
  • Year-round availability (summer up to 40 hours/week) with a reliable mode of transportation.
  • Basic understanding of relational database design and development techniques and conceptual understanding of developing applications in a client-server or web environment preferred.
  • Practical experience or exposure to Oracle or Microsoft development tools, Oracle or SQL-Server databases, ERP, PLM, BI, or CRM application suites, RPA code repository version control, TOAD, iDeveloper, SQL Developer or related products a plus.
  • Educational or work experience with relational database design and development, application development experience in client-server, web, or business intelligence environment a plus
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to effectively juggle competing priorities in a fast-paced work environment
  • Excellent collaboration and communication (written, verbal, and visual) skills
  • Ability to manage timelines with a high desire to learn. Project management capability is a plus
  • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc

The Master Lock Company is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual preference, age, disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. The Master Lock Company also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories.

Overview:

Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is seeking a Business Process Automation Intern to join our growing team at our headquarters in Alexandria, VA.

At MTSI, our more than 1,300 co-owners recognize the high demand for specialized professionals within our industry and that you have many options to choose. As an employee owned company where culture matters, we believe that by investing in our people we are investing in our company’s future!

MTSI’s core capabilities are Systems Engineering and Integration, Modeling and Simulation, Test and Evaluation, Acquisition and Program Support, and Mission Assurance services. Our expertise includes ballistic missile defense, air defense, air vehicle survivability, unmanned aircraft, flight test operations, intelligence support, and cyber/space/homeland defense.

Recognized as an "employee comes first" company with over 27 years of consecutive growth we challenge our co-owners to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry. Overview:

LMI is a consultancy dedicated to powering a future-ready, high-performing government, drawing from expertise in digital and analytic solutions, logistics, and management advisory services. We deliver integrated capabilities that incorporate emerging technologies and are tailored to customers’ unique mission needs, backed by objective research and data analysis. Founded in 1961 to help the Department of Defense resolve complex logistics management challenges, LMI continues to enable growth and transformation, enhance operational readiness and resiliency, and ensure mission success for federal civilian and defense agencies.

The Co-Op Intern (AI Engineer) will work with Forge, LMI’s internal technology accelerator and innovation hub, to develop technology solutions for LMI and its federal government clients. This position will apply machine learning and data science approaches to initiate, develop, and deliver AI within web-based applications. The Intern will work within a team of data scientists, computer scientists, application developers, product managers, and designers to integrate AI/ML into applications to automate and improve business processes, data quality, and user experience. The ideal candidate will have a passion for solving challenging problems by applying a diverse set of technical capabilities to program, develop models, and deploy services consumed by user applications.

Responsibilities:
  • Identify opportunities where AI/ML or modeling and simulation can generate business insights or improve business processes
  • Develop and implement digital and analytic approaches
  • Work with product designers, application developers, infrastructure engineers, and other data scientists to integrate predictive and prescriptive models with web-based applications
  • Research algorithms in machine learning to identify viable approaches to meet business requirements
  • Apply machine learning methods, such as natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, regression, clustering, classification, and deep learning
  • Design solution prototypes that connect to data sources and deploy through services, such as service functions in web applications or application programming interfaces (APIs)
  • Become familiar with DevSecOps principles to continuously deliver high-quality software
  • Work with Docker to develop and deploy containerized versions of models
  • Participate in design and code reviews, and collaborate with a strong, passionate engineering team
  • Provide input to UX/UI designers and front-end application developers on how to effectively deliver model outcomes to users
  • Interface with customer stakeholders to provide technical explanations and support
Qualifications:
    • Must be able to work full-time during the 2021 Fall semester.
    • Must be a candidate for an undergraduate degree (in information technology, operations research, industrial engineering, computer science, data science, systems engineering, applied mathematics, or a related technical discipline).
    • Must have declared a major.
    • Must have a 2.5 GPA or better (copies of unofficial transcripts may be required).
    • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with a project team in an agile research and development environment
    • Comfortable using Atlassian products, including JIRA, Bamboo, Confluence, FishEye, Crucible, and Bitbucket
    • Ability to think critically to propose tractable solutions to complex problems
    • Ability to communicate complex concepts to both technical and business-focused audiences
    • Familiarity or desire to excel with modern programming languages appropriate for machine learning prototyping; Python is preferred, but experience with other languages such as Java, C++, C#, JavaScript and R demonstrate the necessary ability
    • Familiarity with the underlying mathematics of machine learning
    • Knowledge of data structures and data management principles, methods, and tools
    • Desire to explore machine learning frameworks and libraries, such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and Spark ML
    • Ability to work with integrated development environments, such as Jupyter, JupyterLab, JetBrains IntelliJ IDEA, JetBrains PyCharm, JetBrains CLion, and Visual Studio Code
    • Ability to collaborate with a team that develops applications using web development frameworks, such as Angular (1.x/2+), React, and Ember, and server frameworks, such as Node.js and Express.js
    • Ability to consume or interface with cloud computing and storage services, including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud
    • Familiarity or desire to become familiar with containerization technologies, such as Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS), and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS)
    • Superior communication skills, both oral and written.
    • Applicants selected for this position may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Only US Citizens are eligible for a security clearance. For this position, LMI will only consider applicants with security clearances or applicants who are eligible for security clearances.
    • Be available for occasional travel.

      Other Information:

      • Co-Ops will need to provide their own transportation to and from work and locate and arrange for their own housing (if applicable).
      • All Co-Op positions at LMI are paid positions.

A professional attitude and demeanor must be maintained at all times.

Overview:

Assists team in design of small, less-complex material handling systems, including analysis of customer operations, developing, designing and engineering, project management, and integration of multiple technologies. Exposure to data analytics and simulation.

Responsibilities:
  • Assists engineers to design small, less-complex end-to-end material handling systems that integrate multiple technologies such as sortation conveyors, automated storage and retrieval systems, robotics, voice and light picking systems, and supporting structures
  • Assists engineers to detail, design, and engineer scalable, space-optimized storage systems, including rack systems, shelving, and pick modules, that maximize customer efficiency
  • Performs data collection and analysis to define design criteria.
  • Develops 3D simulation and emulation models to validate system design, equipment controls, and system software
  • Uses economics analysis tools to determine return on investment for selected concepts
Qualifications:
  • Studying for a degree in Analytics/Statistics, Computer Science, or Industrial Engineering or related academic experience
  • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to learn new technologies
  • Proficient with Microsoft products
  • Knowledge of process improvement processes and mathematical modeling of systems
  • Knowledge and experience in object-oriented software development and/or scripting.
  • Knowledge of statistical models and distributions.
  • Knowledge of databases and query languages preferred.
  • Knowledge of AutoCAD preferred

Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?
Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.
At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.
With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

You are a student or recent grad who has a passion for collaboration. You are an analytical thinker that has a strong customer focus. You are accountable for researching, analyzing, and documenting clear and actionable business requirements so that information can distribute them across one or more development teams to deliver the desired functionality incrementally.

What You'll Do

    • Shadow Product Manager and a Product Owner
    • Understand the overall theme and operational objectives of the Nalu Payment Solutions vision and product roadmap
    • Analyze, interpret and identify key business requirements
    • Develop and write requirements, acceptance criteria, and prototypes
    • Co-own features and user stories
    • Collaborate and interface with key business and engineering stakeholders to ensure comprehension of requirements amongst stakeholders
    • Drives task completion between the business, product, and development teams to ensure requirements are executed both timely and accurately
    • Attend daily standups, sprints, scheduling, and planning
    • Ability to designs technical workflow diagrams and software documentation utilizing relevant toolsets
    • Translate design requirements to the UI/UX team to produce working prototypes
    • Identify product limitations and has the ability to propose innovative business and technical solutions
    • Understands the interaction of different software components
    • Detail-oriented with excellent writing and communication skills

What You'll Need

    • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or another similar field
    • Demonstrated proficiency in writing and analyzing business processes & procedures documentation
    • Must possess a highly logical and analytical mindset, must be able to multitask and learn quickly
    • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills; ability to interpret requests and give quality results in a timely manner
    • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (experience in MS SQL Server preferred)
    • An understanding of AGILE/SCRUM Methodology
    • Project Coordination/Management experience is a must
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:
  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!
